item.title: Swung Up And Down Hundreds Of Feet...
PEGGY NOONAN
item.description:
www.wsj.com
Read Peggy Noonan on The Wall Street Journal

item.title: HR Depts Turn to A.I.-Enabled Recruiting...
item.description:
www.wsj.com
Artificial intelligence is helping companies across industries answer human resources-related questions, automate some HR tasks and suggest jobs to prospective candidates. In the future, the technology will become even more common in hiring and recruiting, executives say.

item.title: Go-To Suit Designer For Sports Stars -- Also Fugitive...
item.description:
www.wsj.com
Andrew Jang’s fashion label has become a go-to for big events in the sports world. But there’s a warrant for his arrest tracing back to prior businesses he ran under a different name.

item.title: 50 teens caught up in school sexting scandal...
item.description:
www.wsbtv.com
Channel 2's Rikki Klaus was in Union County, where superintendent said most students didn't realize what they were doing is illegal and could have led to child pornography charges.

item.title: Shadowy group trying to overthrow Kim raids NKorea embassy...
item.description:
www.washingtonpost.com
Rumors have swirled about the motivations behind the attack, which took place days before President Trump’s summit with Kim.

item.title: DAVID IGNATIUS
item.description:
www.washingtonpost.com
David Ignatius writes a twice-a-week foreign affairs column.
